body:
Comment 1: 
This is working the way we want it to:
when you run clean.bash it cleans up the
intermediate objects but not the installed
code nor tools.  This means you can run

GOARCH=amd64 ./all.bash
GOARCH=386 ./all.bash

and then at the end you have the tools
and libraries for both architectures installed.

A workaround is to set GOBIN and then
remove it yourself to get rid of everything.
You'll always want to remove the subdirectories
of $GOROOT/pkg.
_Status changed to **WontFix**._
